Sales Demand Forecasting

machine learning
time series analysis
business science
predictive analytics
Author

Eddwin Cheteni

Published

January 23, 2023

Project Overview

Context

The growth of supermarkets in most populated cities is increasing and market competitions are also high. The dataset is one of the historical sales of supermarket company which has recorded in 3 different branches for 3 months data. Predictive data analytics methods are easy to apply to this dataset. The data used can be downloaded here.

Import Libraries

1. Prepare Data

1.1 Import Data

Loading the supermarket_sales dataset

Click here to view code 
data <- read_csv("./supermarket_sales.csv", 
      
    # recast `Date` and `Time` column data types
    col_types = cols(Date = col_date(format = "%m/%d/%Y"), 
        Time = col_time(format = "%H:%M")))%>%
  
  # recast character to factor data type columns
    mutate_if(is.character, as_factor)%>%
  
    # Renaming Columns: set_names()
    set_names(names(.) %>% str_replace_all(" ","_"))

# view first 5 rows of the dataset
data %>%
  head(5) %>%
  gt() %>%
  tab_header(
    title = "View First 5 Rows of Supermarket Sales Data"
  )

Click here to view code 
data %>% 
  plot_missing()

Wrangle Data

Sales by Product Line

Click here to view code 
data%>%
  group_by(Product_line)%>%
  summarise(total_sales = sum(Total))%>%
  ungroup()%>%
  mutate(sales_text = scales::dollar(total_sales))%>%
  gt()
Product_line total_sales sales_text
Health and beauty 49193.74 $49,193.74
Electronic accessories 54337.53 $54,337.53
Home and lifestyle 53861.91 $53,861.91
Sports and travel 55122.83 $55,122.83
Food and beverages 56144.84 $56,144.84
Fashion accessories 54305.89 $54,305.90

Sales by Gender

Click here to view code 
data %>% 
  group_by(Gender)%>%
  summarise(total_sales = sum(Total))%>%
  ungroup()%>%
  mutate(sales_text = scales::dollar(total_sales)) %>%
  gt()
Gender total_sales sales_text
Female 167882.9 $167,883
Male 155083.8 $155,084

Sales by Branch

Click here to view code 
data %>% 
  group_by(Branch)%>%
  summarise(total_sales = sum(Total))%>%
  ungroup()%>%
  mutate(sales_text = scales::dollar(total_sales)) %>%
  gt()
Branch total_sales sales_text
A 106200.4 $106,200
C 110568.7 $110,569
B 106197.7 $106,198

Sales by Customer Type

Click here to view code 
data %>% 
  group_by(Customer_type)%>%
  summarise(total_sales = sum(Total))%>%
  ungroup()%>%
  mutate(sales_text = scales::dollar(total_sales)) %>%
  gt()
Customer_type total_sales sales_text
Member 164223.4 $164,223
Normal 158743.3 $158,743

Sales by city

Click here to view code 
data %>% 
  group_by(City)%>%
  summarise(total_sales = sum(Total))%>%
  ungroup()%>%
  mutate(sales_text = scales::dollar(total_sales)) %>%
  gt()
City total_sales sales_text
Yangon 106200.4 $106,200
Naypyitaw 110568.7 $110,569
Mandalay 106197.7 $106,198
